abstract: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York considers routing motorcade of Pope Francis through Central Park on upcoming visit to city so that more people will be able to see him; Police Dept prepares for added security problems protecting pontiff who has expressed desire to mingle with crowds; transportation routes along Northeast Corridor are expected to be especially congested during pope's three-city tour.
lead_paragraph: The archdiocese is considering a public motorcade that would allow more New Yorkers to catch a glimpse of the pope, an official said.

headline.main: Pope Francis May Pass Through Central Park During New York Visit
headline.print_headline: Pope May Pass Through Central Park on Trip

snippet: The archdiocese is considering a public motorcade that would allow more New Yorkers to catch a glimpse of the pope, an official said.
